author: Ashish Cardanoscan
title: Testnet Cardanoscan Explorer
description: IOHK dev explorer for testnet does not provide useful insights that developers need. Many developers are asking for a testnet Cardanoscan.

assessments.note: There is already a test net block explorer by the Cardano foundation. However, it is missing features such as Cardanoscan has features to query tokens, policies, stake keys, stake key mapped addresses, pool updates, insights into all types of certificates, including the voting rewards.

Having a UI explorer for testnet likely reduces friction in developing on Cardano. Ease of use is beneficial in bringing more developers to the Cardano ecosystem. Thus, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
This tool would greatly add to the ability of developers to test their code before rolling out to the full production system.
Cardanoscan is a swiff knife explorer for developers. Most of the developers start their journey on testnet and this will definitely help them.
cardanoscan is used quite extensively for development activities. There is a need for more than one blockchain explorer application to gain insight into the status and operations of transactions.
Every developer relies on testnet, this proposal may help developers in visualizing network data quickly which helps mainly for debugging purposes

As mentioned in the problem statement there are quiet a few information and insights that are not directly available in testnet from existing explorer and considering the provision of cardanoscan into testnet provides better insights and effectively reduce the grey areas
Blocksscan already operates a block explorer for the main net.
This proposal is self-explanatory in that essentially prior work be ported to the testnet. I have the upmost confidence that the proposer implements the proposal successfully.
Cardanoscan itself is a showcase of this developer experience.

The proposers are operating one of the most used blockchain explorers. They have demonstrated capability. The proposal is not offering major technical challenges and should be fairly simple to execute.
As far as I have seen cardanoscan provides data quick and mostly accurate data. High likely that they can build successful testnet version of cardanoscan.
Given the fact that the team of developers are running it on mainnet they are efficient eough to pull this off
The amount of work is very limited ; the proposal is mostly about maintenance and opex.

The proposal is outlined with all the information that shows existing work and how it can be ported to the testnet - which is a request by many developers. The proposer further illustrates that the testnet explorer will actually require more maintenance as things are expected to break frequently.
The proposal is detailed and fills an obvious need for developers.
Goal and success is defined, it is pretty clear.

The progress involves copying and migrating existing explorer to testnet. The proposal is for funding the initiative for six months, and the proposer aims to make it self-sustaining in six months. The progress is clearly measurable and can be monitored.
As we all have seen the effective implementation of cardanoscan, it would be easier to measure the implementation of testnet version of it.

They have clearly mentioned the details about the motivation behind choosing the problem statement and have explained about how they are planning to resolve it so the required information is out there

solution: Cardanoscan has lots of developer-friendly insights into the Cardano blockchain. We will make the platform available for the testnet network
experience: We are running the mainnet version of Cardanoscan explorer - the leading Cardano explorer
